      • standardAddMedia

        private void standardAddMedia(java.lang.String jsonBody,
                    java.lang.String eventToken,
                    int expectedStatus,
                    int expectedNewMediaNumber,
                    java.lang.String token)
        Simple useful function that generates "add media" test from the parameters.
        Parameters:
        jsonBody - : the request json body
        eventToken - : the token of the event that will contain (or not) the media
        expectedStatus - : the expected Http response status
        expectedNewMediaNumber - : the expected number of media in the table after running this test
        token - : the string corresponding to the current connected user (or null if there is not)

      • standardUpdateMedia

        private void standardUpdateMedia(java.lang.String jsonBody,
                       java.lang.Integer mediaId,
                       int expectedStatus,
                       boolean checkNewValues,
                       java.lang.String expectedNewName,
                       java.lang.String expectedNewDescription,
                       java.lang.String token)
        Simple useful function that generates "update media" test from the parameters.
        Parameters:
        jsonBody - : the request json body
        mediaId - : the id of the media to update
        expectedStatus - : the expected Http response status
        checkNewValues - : check or not the new values (name, description ...)
        expectedNewName - : the expected new media name
        expectedNewDescription - : the expected new media description
        token - : the string corresponding to the current connected user (or null if there is not)

      • standardDeleteMedia

        private void standardDeleteMedia(java.lang.Integer mediaId,
                       int expectedStatus,
                       int expectedNewMediaNumber,
                       java.lang.String token)
        Simple useful function that generates "delete media" test from the parameters.
        Parameters:
        mediaId - : the id of the media to update
        expectedStatus - : the expected Http response status
        expectedNewMediaNumber - : the expected number of media in the table after running this test
        token - : the string corresponding to the current connected user (or null if there is not)
